headline: weather advisory in effect
description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect.

What:
Locally heavy snowfall with total accumulations of 5 to 10 cm.
Peak snowfall rates of 3 to 5 cm per hour.
Reduced visibility at times in heavy snow.
Strong northwesterly winds gusting up to 70 km/h tonight.

Timing:
Late this morning through this afternoon for the initial band of heavy snow.
This evening through tonight for the lake effect flurries, strong winds and local blowing snow.

Discussion:
An area of heavy snow will push through the region today. The majority of snow will fall within a few hours. By this evening, strong northwesterly winds gusting up to 70 km/h and lake effect flurries will develop, resulting in reduced visibility at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winds and flurries will weaken early Tuesday morning.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas. If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop.
